programme.title: Monwabisi
programme.desc: Monwa’s life is tied to the sea. However, his relationship to the marine environment is based in fear. David and the crew aim to help him overcome this fear by getting him into the water. Monwa learns to free dive, and once the crew is satisfied that he can handle more, Monwa takes the plunge and swims with blue sharks in an underwater canyon off the coast of the Cape of Good Hope.

programme.title: Africa's Primeval Oceans
programme.desc: The scene is the southern tip of Africa. Just off shore, two very different seas meet to form one of the most diverse marine environments on earth. The meeting of icy Atlantic and warm Indian waters not only affect life underwater, they are giant forces that shape the land, climate, and all its creatures. The Portuguese explorer Bartholomew Dias and his crew called it the Cape of Storms.

programme.title: Saving Sharks, Raising Awareness
programme.desc: Every hour 10,000 sharks are fished worldwide. Yet, this mythical predator plays a key role in regulating marine life. So now, Jérôme Delafosse has launched The Shark Project - a plea to reconcile humankind with the scary shark - and is traveling the globe to raise awareness about these marvelous animals. Can Jérôme save our sharks from possible extinction?

programme.title: Submarines: The Invisible Weapon
programme.desc: You can’t see them. You can’t hear them. And you never know exactly where they are. The life of submarines is secret and fascinating. In this film, we go inside one of the French navy's legendary vessels, the Rubis, and to where the next nuclear submarine, the Barracuda, is being built. From technological prowess to human exploits, the film submerges us in a timeless amphibian adventure.

programme.title: Peregrine Falcon: Lord of the Skies
programme.desc: While hunting, it can reach speeds of over 90 miles per hour but during its aerial displays it holds the all-time speed record of 242 miles per hour. So it’s not surprising that this powerful bird has conquered the planet and can be found on the five continents. Worshipped, sculpted or trained for prestigious hunts, the power and beauty of this bird has always fascinated mankind.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Fatal Flaw" - Parents rush their baby to the hospital, but she tragically dies in her mother's arms. Now, Dr. G must help these devastated parents understand what happened.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Deadly Dive" - A train engineer panics when he spots a man lying on the tracks. He blows the whistle, but the train can't stop in time. It's up to Dr. G to piece together how Andy Santana died.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Deadly Decent" - It's up to Dr. G, along with the National Transportation Safety Board, to piece together how and why a plane crashed, leaving the pilot dead.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "A Deadly Deal" - Reed Baley is found unconscious the morning after his bachelor party. Now, it's up to Dr. G to determine if alcohol was to blame or if there was another cause of death.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Evil Intent" - Authorities respond to a fire, only to find Carolyn Casey's body at the center of the blaze. With little evidence and no witnesses, Dr. G must find the cause of death to catch her killer.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Disturbing Behavior" - Leo Guzman falls off a ladder while painting a house. At first, his death seems to be an open-and-shut case but, as the autopsy unfolds, Dr. G believes there may be more to this case.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Wounded" - A teen is eating breakfast when his dad starts stabbing himself. As the investigation unfolds, police begin to doubt the story. Dr. G must determine if this was a suicide or a murder.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Hidden Killers" - When Marie Allen visits her sister, she makes a gruesome discovery: the 49-year-old is dead on the couch. Now, it's up to Dr. G to figure out if this was an accident or something sinister.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Playing With Fire" - Dr. Farley discusses the bizarre case of a pregnant mother who suddenly dies. As the autopsy unfolds, Dr. Farley uncovers information that could have saved her and her unborn child's life.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Deadly Bite" - Roy Cambells is found dead and covered with scratches, his aggressive 80lb dog by his side. Dr. G wonders if the dog could have been responsible for the man's death.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When an elderly couple died in a suspicious house fire, their son became the prime suspect. Investigators turned to forensic science to determine if the fire had been set deliberately, or if it was an unfortunate accident.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When hunters found a skull in a Texas canyon, police found bits of clothing, small bones and a strand of hair. A forensic artist reconstructed her face. Now all they had to do was find her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A married couple decided to escape the cold of winter with a mini-vacation in Key West. The wife went missing, and police searched every square inch of the island, they found nothing but a pair of sandals which might have belonged to her.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A mother of two young children was found dead in her bedroom. Her death was ruled a suicide - but when investigators learned she had almost died in a house fire three years earlier, they decided to take another look at the evidence.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Bombings are difficult to solve, because the perpetrator isn't usually at the scene, and the evidence goes up in smoke. In this case pieces of plastic the size of grains of sand hold the key to a man's murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The wife of an Air Force officer was found dead in her bed with a plastic laundry bag near her face. Further investigation proved that the scene had been staged. Her death wasn't an accident, it was cold-blooded murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a fire destroyed most of a home and a young boy went missing, police organized the largest search in the history of their small town. First the boy's backpack was discovered five miles from home, and then his body was found 50 miles away.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: highway patrolman was dispatched to what he thought would be a routine traffic accident until he looked in the car. While he had no formal training in forensic science, he had seen hundreds of accidents - but never as much blood as this.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A behavioral profile caused the Baton Rouge Police Department to search for the wrong man. They might not have made an arrest had it not been for a DNA picture of the suspect painted by a molecular biologist.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An obstetrician returned home from the hospital and found his wife on the bathroom floor. She was covered with blood and not breathing. He tried unsuccessfully to revive her, staining his clothes with her blood in the process, and then he called 911.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A Modesto, California teenager went missing. There was no sign of a struggle in her home, and police suspected she'd simply run away until her naked, bruised body was discovered in a ditch 20 miles away.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Emergency dispatch received a call from a man who said his girlfriend shot and killed herself. The autopsy revealed that the gunshot wound was not self-inflicted and the evidence on her body would give police a golden opportunity to catch her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Midwest Whitetail Offseason S12:E1 "Call Rutting Bucks: 190” Giant Comes Running, Public Land Team Effort"
programme.desc: Bill weighs in on his strategies for getting bucks to come into range in late October.

programme.title: Midwest Whitetail Offseason S12:E2 "Big Shed Antlers, When to Snort-Wheeze"
programme.desc: On this week's episode, we first join Josh Sparks and Kaleb Greiner shed hunting in Iowa. They've picked up some good antlers including two bucks they know well. Then we join Jared Mills who discusses why frost seeding clover can be so productive and how to do it. Finally, Bill covers a hunt from 2008 with his good friend, Mike Sawyer, where a snort wheeze call was the key to a successful harvest.

programme.title: Midwest Whitetail Offseason S12:E3 "Off-Beat Tips for November Success, Shed Hunting"
programme.desc: On this week's episode we start things off with Bill performing soil tests on the farm. He explains both how he does these tests and why it's important to do them to get the most out of your land. Next we join Drake Lamb who gives an update on a buck he presumed was dead. Finally, we join Jared Mills who updates us on some of the antlers he and Mike found on their river farm. He also covers a successful hunt from November of 2013, when he snuck in at midnight to hang a stand. Here is a link to the soil test kits: https://www.frigidforage.com/hot-buys/soil-test-kit/

programme.title: Red Rising S6:E7 "Sand Creed Whitetails: Take 1"
programme.desc: Eric and Jason join Cody Lee and family in Texas at Sand Creek Whitetails for some unbelievable whitetail action and even finer accommodations.

programme.title: Red Rising S6:E8 "Sand Creek Whitetails: Take 2"
programme.desc: Matt and Chris are hoping to turn their seasons around by joining up with Cody Lee and family in Texas at Sand Creek Whitetails.

programme.title: Red Rising S6:E3 "Wheat State:Take 1"
programme.desc: Eric and Jason waste no time as Eric draws first blood in Kansas right out the gate.

programme.title: Limitless S1:E2 "Smith Lake"
programme.desc: We kept the momentum rolling on Smith Lake in stop #2 of the Tackle Warehouse Pro Circuit. There's plenty of content on the way and I can't wait to share the rest of this year's adventures with you all!

programme.title: Limitless S1:E3 "Lake Murray"
programme.desc: The 3rd event of the season was a fun one! A little stumble on day one set up a big day 2 comeback! Fishing the herring spawn can be absolute chaos. the bass set up and respond in such particular ways. It was a fun week trying to figure them out. If you could get the timing right, the bite was incredible.

programme.title: Fly Rod Chronicles S17:E1 "Fly Fishing England Pt1"
programme.desc: Curtis heads across the pond to England to explore some of the most famous rivers in the world. Watch as Curtis and his buddy Rick Heim travel across the UK taking in all the culture and ofcourse catch some amazing fish!

programme.title: HOOKED ON FRESHWATER "Fly Fishing England Part 2"
programme.desc: Fly Rod Chronicles S17:E2 - On this episode of Fly Rod Chronicles Curtis and the crew stays in England for Fly Fishing England Pt2, they take in some more history about the birthplace of fly fishing and catch some huge fish on the fly!! You have to watch this epic show!!

programme.title: Sweetwater S6:E1 "Our Pal Buddy"
programme.desc: The Sweetwater guys are joined by professional bass angler and Tennessee Valley guru Buddy Gross.

programme.title: On The Water S16:E1 "Delaware River Shad"
programme.desc: Chris & Jimmy intercept migrating American shad in the beautiful & wild Delaware Water Gap.

programme.title: On The Water S16:E2 "Cape Cod King Mackerel"
programme.desc: Andy & Captain Terry head out in search of a surprising summer visitor to the waters of Cape Cod.

programme.title: Fish Addictions S6:E1 "How To Catch Backwoods Crappies"
programme.desc: During this week’s episode, the team and I revisited an old honey hole of mine from my childhood to chase big northern Minnesota Crappies. During this episode, we were able to use the Garmin LiveScope to stay on a school of Crappies roaming a deep basin.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries S5:E1 "Stripers"
programme.desc: JP Travels to the Connecticut River to target Striped Bass with Captain Blaine Anderson.

programme.title: Reel West Coast S3:E5 "Northern Rockies Lodge Part One"
programme.desc: Located in the Northernmost part of the Rocky Mountains, Brendan and Blake Sloan get dropped off by bush pilot to different alpine lakes and target 7 different species of fish using all different types of gear and techniques.

programme.title: Reel West Coast S3:E6 "Northern Rockies Lodge Part Two"
programme.desc: Brendan and Blake Sloan fly to different remote alpine lakes in northern BC and have an incredible experience while searching for monster-sized lake trout.

programme.title: Lunkerville S13:E7 "The Fishin Musician"
programme.desc: Adirondack music legend and avid bass fisherman Rich Ortiz takes Mike D spring bass fishing in upstate New York. Conditions in April see water temps in the 40’s as the two use jigs and flukes to target staging fish.

programme.title: Fish Addictions S6:E2 "Putting on a Clinic Lake Of The Woods Walleye Fishing"
programme.desc: As the second episode into the season and we couldn't be more excited to hit the ice for some walleye fishing in one of our favorite places. Lake of the Woods, the walleye capital of the world. Four guys fishing in one shack, plus a few lines spread out. Think they were able to pull it off? Check out the whole video to find out!

programme.title: Behind The Season "The Hill"
programme.desc: John started an outfitting business to sell hunts on his property that we all know as The Hill.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Chris Voth - Cashmere
programme.desc: Chris Voth is an accomplished comedian, a licensed teacher, and a published author. Voth made his debut late-night television appearance on the Late Late Show with Craig Ferguson. He also appeared in three seasons of NBC's Last Comic Standing and was chosen for the prestigious Great American Comedy Festival. A 15-year comedy veteran, Voth is a past winner of the Denver Comedy Works Competition and has worked with everyone from Dave Chappelle to Larry the Cable Guy to Linda Ronstadt. Voth’s first comedy CD titled "Never Mind the Jim J Bullocks, Here's the Chris Voth" is currently available for purchase. Chris currently balances his performance schedule with his full-time high-school teaching career. You can read his short story, "Stand Up and Deliver," published in the Cream City Review Literary Journal. In it, Chris shares the experiences he had when entering the teaching field after years in stand-up comedy.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Dave Nihill - Documented
programme.desc: Dave is the winner of the prestigious 43rd annual San Francisco Comedy Competition, and runner up in the Moth’s largest US Grandslam storytelling competition.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Costaki Economopoulos - Now That I'm A Grown-up
programme.desc: For 20 years Costaki has been living his dream as a full-time stand up comic. He has written jokes for Bette Midler, Jay Leno, MTV, and BET. You may have seen him on Showtime or heard him on Sirius, but you probably know him best from his regular appearances on the nationally syndicated Bob & Tom Radio Show.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Scott Novotny - A Trip to Goofyville
programme.desc: Scott Novotny brings his high-energy goofyness to the live audience at VidAngel Studios.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Karen Morgan - Go Dawgs!
programme.desc: A former trial attorney, she moved from the courtroom to comedy after being selected as a Finalist on Nickelodeon TV’s Search for the Funniest Mom in America.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Josh Blue - The Disabled List
programme.desc: Following his groundbreaking win on NBC’s Last Comic Standing in 2006, Josh Blue has risen through the ranks to become a well-established headliner at venues throughout the world.

programme.title: Steve Soelberg - WE SAY BIM
programme.desc: Extremely funny comedian and overall nice person Steve Soelberg brings an observational, story telling style of comedy which has repeatedly left his regularly sold out audiences in stitches. Whether he's relating the experiences of growing up in a large family in Seattle, Washington or recounting the time he saw an angry guy in a tutu at a Ragnar relay, he has a way of making each audience member feel as if they were just the person he wanted to tell the story to because he knew they'd enjoy it just as much as he did. Due to his growing popularity as a comedian, he has appeared multiple times on local TV affiliates (Fox, KUTV, and KSL), on the radio, and has entertained tens of thousands traveling the country not only as comedian, but also as the voice of the Ragnar relay races as their race announcer and emcee. Steve's positive, upbeat personality paired with his observational, often self deprecating humor and his ability to appeal to a broad audience guarantee his shows will be a hilarious and memorable experience for all those who attend.

programme.title: Taylor Mason - Hysterical Perspective
programme.desc: Taylor Mason is your average, run-of-the-mill writer, performer, singer-songwriter, ventriloquist, comedian, entertainer, rock’n’roller, puppeteer, pianist, entertainer, and is here now for Dry Bar Comedy.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Phil Kopczynski - Full Grown Man
programme.desc: Phil Kopczynski is a reluctant nice guy and father who just wants to occasionally play in the wilderness and regularly make city-dwellers laugh.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Kortney Shane Williams - Unsubstantiated
programme.desc: The master of satire has been a part of The Bridgetown Comedy Festival, Boston Comedy Festival, Laughing Skull Comedy Festival, and Bumbershoot Arts festival. Kortney’s self-deprecating humor has won him finalist spots in both Comedy Central’s South Beach Comedy Festival Competition and NBC’s Stand-Up Showcase.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Andrew Sleighter - Breakfast Stealer
programme.desc: Andrew Sleighter started in comedy looking for the perfect funny line to open a biography. Since then, Andrewís laid-back style and clever writing has won him appreciation from fans and respect from his peers. A regular at colleges and comedy clubs across the country, Andrewís also performed at some of the most prestigious comedy festivals in and out of the country including Bumbershoot, Bridgetown, The Cabo Comedy Festival, The Aspen Comedy Festival, Laughing Skull, and the Johnny Carson Great American Comedy Festival. Andrew wrote and blogged for the Sports Show with Norm Macdonald on Comedy Central and was a regular on the MTV prank show Money From Strangers. Heís performed on Nuvo TVís Stand Up & Deliver, Last Comic Standing, and made his late-night stand-up debut on Conan. Andrewís comedy has the ability to reach wide ranges of audiences and works in a diversity of rooms. Reliable and consistent, he rarely ends a show by lighting the stage on fire out of rage. Most importantly, heís constantly fascinated by and eager to keep learning about stand-up.

programme.title: Cash Levy - Game of Chance
programme.desc: If you missed Cash on Fox Sports or haven't bought his newly released comedy CD, Extemporaneous, you're probably familiar with seeing his act on Comedy Central, Fox Sports, NBC, The Late Late Show with Craig Ferguson (CBS), Comics Unleashed, Just For Laughs Toronto, Moontowers Comedy Festival, Comedy.TV. and the Hollywood Improv. Ifyou haven't had time to watch you may have heard Cash on SiriusXM or as a regular guest on The Bob and Tom Show. Internationally, Cash has performed for U.S. troops all over the world, from Afghanistan to Singapore. Recently he wrote for the Critics Choice Awards.Cash Levy is known as one of the finest improvisers in the country, so you might enjoy his Podcast, "Cashing in With T.J. MIller" or his newest one-hour comedy special "Crowd Control". Come see why the Denver Post called Cash Levy's show "Refreshingly unrehearsed, this is what live comedy is all about."

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Chelle T - It Just Got Real
programme.desc: As a mother of seven, Chelle T has seen it all, and shes not afraid to joke about it. Quippy and honest, Chelle T talks about how children are raised differently these days, menopause, being married for twenty-three years, and how desperate you sometimes become when youre a mom in this special.
